In great condition - and an iconic sculptural design.

We love the jelly like colours that American Pressed glass was so known for back in the early 20th Century.

name: SOLD Iconic Olivetti Studio 42 Typewriter
description:
Sorry Just sold - please do get in touch at enquiries@retropolitan.co.uk if you'd like us to source something similar. 

This is a thing of modernist beauty! Introduced in 1935 and produced throughout the war. A semi-portable model, the Studio 42 is beautiful from it's chromed OLIVETTI to it's pure functionality.. The mechanics were developed by engineer Ottavio Luzzati while architects Figini & Pollini and Bauhaus-designer Xanti Schawinsky were responsible for the overall design.
This works well, could do with a new ribbon (slightly fading ink) - these are avalable on ebay. Comes in a leatherette case. Overall very good condition (slight worn patch on case) 
Stock no KC101

Please contact us at enquiries@retropolitan.co.uk about shipping before you purchase this - it is very heavy - so will need to arrange a bespoke dispatch.

This is a stunning and very collectable vase. Made by Ernest Gordon for Afors - he worked there from he late 1950s to mid 1960s. A very good glass designer - hispieces fetch high prices in autions.
This is a cased vase which is solid black - very unusual, we believe a mark of Gordon..as were the very symmetrical small bubbles. 
Signed on the base, with Afors and his full name.
IN good condition - no discernible marks
Size: H:17.5cm W:11.5cm

name: SOLD - 1950s Glass Ice Bucket
description:
This is a stunning midcentury piece of art glass, but also very functional. A heavy sturdy design - would look perfect with a bottle of bubbly in!
Made with tiny internal bubbles, and has a polished pontil..we are unsure of the manufacturer - maybe Webb or Whitefriars - either way is a quality item.
In great condition. 
Size: H:25cm W:21cm
